attributes.additional_details:
In the last 3 years my village has seen a growth in housing developments, which currently has increased the number of homes by
50%. The village has no street lights, a small oversubscribed doctors surgery, limited public transport that does not run in the evenings or weekends and a small oversubscribed primary school. Due to the incompetence of our local authority in now producing a 5 year plan, us residents are now at the mercy of developers who use this loophole to line their pockets.
attributes.background: To prevent overdevelopment, specifically in Wealden, an area of natural beauty. Wealden residents have and are facing an extortionate amount of large housing developments. Wealden District Council has failed to provide a 5 year housing plan and now Developers are able to use this to their advantage

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about local planning decisions are a matter for local planning authorities, not the Government or Parliament. As a result it is not possible for the Government or Parliament to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
